    • Add new sites

    Add new sites

    Kelly Hondula

    2018-07-04

    newsites.Rmd

    In ODM2 lingo, sites are a type of sampling feature. They must have:

    • a unique short code name (max 50 characters),
    • a unique UUID (which can be generated with the uuid package),
    • and be classified as one of the pre-defined types of sampling features such as “Site” or “Weather station”.

    They can also have:

    • a longer name (max 255 characters),
    • even longer description (max 5000 characters),
    • spatial/geometry information,
    • elevation information,
    • annotations like a type of “Site group”,
    • defined relationships to other sites.

    All actions must be performed at/on/to a sampling feature!

    Add a site without any geographic info

    Add points from lat lon data

    # db_insert_sites_latlon(new_sites)

    Add points from a kmz (Google Earth) file

    Add relationships between sites

    If sites are related to each other, make use of the relatedfeatures table by specifying parent-child or other types of relationships.

    This allows for making a network graph showing how sites are related to each other.

    Add Site Group annotations

    Add annotations about groups of sites.

    Contents

    • Add points from lat lon data
    • Add points from a kmz (Google Earth) file
    • Add relationships between sites
    • Add Site Group annotations
